node.title: What are the rules in Tasmania if you are unvaxed when the borders open?
node.alt: Close-up of woman's face and hands putting on a mask during the coronavirus pandemic in Australia.
node.description: Tasmania's borders are opening and COVID-19 is coming, so what are the rules if you get infected and you are unvaccinated?
node.content:
["In less than three weeks, Tasmania will reopen to the rest of Australia.\u00a0", "Premier Peter Gutwein has released his government's plan for how coronavirus cases will be handled after December 15.", "Here's a look at how it'll work.", "", "
The Premier says people who are unvaccinated and are a close contact of a positive case will have to quarantine for two weeks.(ABC News)
", "
Oh no, I've caught coronavirus! What now?
", "People who test positive for coronavirus will have to isolate for a minimum of 10 days.", "They will be able to isolate at home if it's considered a \"suitable premises\".", "Anyone living in the same household is considered a close contact and also have to quarantine but the number of days will depend on factors such as vaccination status and length of exposure.", "Isolation may be extended if symptoms persist.", "
How do I know if I'm a casual contact?
", "A casual contact is someone who has been in the same place as a person with coronavirus but has not had prolonged face-to-face contact with them.", "\"An example of a casual contact may be a hospitality worker who is serving tables where there is a positive case. However, they did not have direct, face-to-face contact for a long period of time with the patron,\" Mr Gutwein said.", "\"Another example could be a retail store employee who served a patron who was positive but had less than 15 minutes contact with them and a Perspex sneeze shield in place on the counter providing separation and the business was taking necessary precautions under their COVID-safe plan.\"", "A casual contact will not need to quarantine but will need to get a test between days three to five.", "It may depend on whether the shared space is indoors or outdoors, vaccination status and whether personal protective equipment (PPE) was being worn.", "If they can't physically distance when out and about, they will need to wear a mask.", "
OK, so what if I'm a close contact?
", "A close contact is someone who has had prolonged exposure or face-to-face contact with a COVID-19 case, such as eating together in a restaurant, or a housemate.", "\"This means if you were, for 15 minutes or more, sitting next to someone in the car, sitting on the same table at a restaurant or sharing a small office space while the positive case was infectious, including the 72 hours before they developed symptoms, you would be a close contact,\" Mr Gutwein said.", "Health workers are not considered close contacts because they wear PPE.", "
I'm vaccinated. Will I have to quarantine if I'm a close contact?
", "In short, yes. People who have been vaccinated and come into contact with someone with COVID-19 will be required to quarantine for one week.", "They will also need to have three tests: one immediately after being identified as a close contact, another on days five or six and again on days 12 or 13.", "They will be able to leave quarantine pending a negative test after seven days.", "Unvaccinated people living with a vaccinated close contact will be asked to quarantine for one week too.", "From days eight to 14, vaccinated close contacts will have to wear a mask if they're unable to physically distance in the community or at work, and are required to avoid non-essential activities, high-risk settings and vulnerable people, such as people who are pregnant or elderly.", "
What if I'm not vaccinated?
", "", "
The Premier says 26,000 Tasmanians are still to receive their second dose.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "You will be required to quarantine for 14 days, and will also have to have three tests in the same time frame.", "Unvaccinated people living in the same home will also have to quarantine for two weeks, while vaccinated people will have to avoid high-risk settings and may be required to wear a face mask.", "Mr Gutwein encouraged Tasmanians to get the jab, saying it was the best protection against COVID-19.", "\"We have 26,500 people that need to turn up for their second dose, and we've got two and a half weeks to do it,\" he said.", "\"If you're waiting on a second dose, make certain that you get it before the 15th, when we reopen our borders.\"", "
Will my business have to close if a customer has COVID?
", "", "
The Premier says closing a business \"would only be a last resort option\" if there is an outbreak.\u00a0(AAP)
", "Under the plan released on Friday, businesses should be able to continue trading even if they're visited by a positive case as long as they clean and disinfect their premises.", "Staff, customers and clients will have to follow isolation and quarantine guidelines.", "It is still up to business owners whether they mandate vaccinations for their workforce.", "Mr Gutwein urged business owners to consult the WorkSafe website and said the Tasmanian Chamber of Commerce and Industry and Business Tasmania would provide additional support to businesses as needed over the next fortnight.", "He has encouraged businesses to review their COVID safety plan in case it needs updating.", "\"Closure would only be a last-resort option if a wider outbreak should occur in a business setting and it's unsafe for staff and patrons.\"", "", "
The government is providing fact sheets and information on its website about the new requirements.\u00a0(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "", "
What COVID-19 travel insurance doesn't cover you for(Emilia Terzon)
"]
